ai.summary: John Corbett Way is a challenging 25.3 km hike in the UK designed for experienced hikers. The route traverses varied terrain with long ascents and exposed sections, demanding good navigation and fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of well-marked paths, rough trails, boggy ground, rocky sections, and several ascents/descents. Some segments may include gates or stiles and occasional road crossings. Weather in the UK can be unpredictable, so footing can be slippery.
ai.safety_notes: The hike is strenuous and weather can change quickly; carry a map, compass and a fully charged phone. Tell someone your planned route and expected return time. Watch for mud, flooding, and poor visibility; daylight hours vary by season. In remote sections, have extra layers and emergency shelter; be prepared to turn back in adverse conditions.
recommended_gear: Thermal base layers and mid-layer fleece
Map and compass; optional GPS device
Fully charged phone with offline maps; power bank
First aid kit and any personal medications
Headlamp or trekking lantern with extra batteries
Whistle and emergency shelter or bivy sack
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly March to October) offers the best weather and daylight for a 25.3 km hard hike in the UK; winter hiking is possible with extra precautions and shorter daylight.

seo.title: John Corbett Way – 25.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover John Corbett Way, a demanding 25.3 km hike in the UK. Read the route overview, terrain notes, safety tips, best seasons, and gear recommendations.
